body:
# DeepL.cr [![CI](https://github.com/kojix2/deepl.cr/actions/workflows/test.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/kojix2/deepl.cr/actions/workflows/test.yml) [![Docs Latest](https://img.shields.io/badge/docs-latest-blue.svg)](https://kojix2.github.io/deepl.cr/) [![Lines of Code](https://img.shields.io/endpoint?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftokei.kojix2.net%2Fapi%2Fbadge%2Flines%3Furl%3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fkojix2%2Fdeepl.cr%2F)](https://tokei.kojix2.net/analyze?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fkojix2%2Fdeepl.cr%2F) [![Ask DeepWiki](https://deepwiki.com/badge.svg)](https://deepwiki.com/kojix2/deepl.cr) Crystal library for the [DeepL language translation API](https://www.deepl.com/pro-api/). ## Installation 1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`: ```yaml dependencies: deepl: github: kojix2/deepl ``` 2. Run `shards install` ## Usage ```crystal require "deepl" # Translate text t = DeepL::Translator.new(auth_key: "YOUR_AUTH_KEY") puts t.translate_text("こんにちは、世界！", target_lang: "EN") # => "Hello, world!" # Translate document t = DeepL::Translator.new(auth_key: "YOUR_AUTH_KEY") puts t.translate_document("path/to/document.pdf", target_lang: "EN") # Save to file (default: "path/to/document_EN.pdf") # Rephrase text (improve writing) t = DeepL::Translator.new(auth_key: "YOUR_AUTH_KEY") result = t.rephrase_text("I have went to the store yesterday.") puts result[0].text # => "I went to the store yesterday." ``` See [documentation](https://kojix2.github.io/deepl.cr/). ### Environment Variables
Name Description
DEEPL_AUTH_KEY DeepL API authentication key
DEEPL_TARGET_LANG Default target language
DEEPL_USER_AGENT User-Agent
- When the environment variable `DEEPL_TARGET_LANG` is set, the method `DeepL::Translator#guess_target_language` will prioritize the language defined in `DEEPL_TARGET_LANG`. - However, please note that this does not directly affect translation methods like `translate_text`. ## Development - Pull requests are welcome. - If you want to take over the project and become the owner, please submit your request with a pull request. - [DeepL OpenAPI Specification](https://github.com/DeepLcom/openapihttps://github.com/DeepLcom/openapi) ### Run tests (v2 / v3) - v2 (default): ```bash crystal spec ``` - v3 (compile-time flag): ```bash crystal spec -Ddeepl_v3 ``` - v3 (environment variable): ```bash DEEPL_API_VERSION=v3 crystal spec ``` Note: The library surface is also switched by the same conditions. ## Use case - [DeepL CLI](https://github.com/kojix2/deepl-cli) ## Contributing 1. Fork it () 2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`) 3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`) 4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`) 5. Create a new Pull Request # License MIT

def.name: summary
def.body:
String.build do |s|
  s << "(i) #{id}"
  s << " (s) #{status}"
  if seconds_remaining
    s << " (r) #{seconds_remaining}"
  end
  if billed_characters
    s << " (c) #{billed_characters}"
  end
  if error_message
    s << " (e) #{error_message}"
  end
end

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(source_lang, target_lang, entries, entries_format, entry_count, creation_time)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

constants.name: DEEPL_DEFAULT_SERVER_URL
constants.doc:
Note: The default server URL is set during the compilation process.
To change the default server URL, you need to recompile the code.

instance_methods.name: base_server_url
instance_methods.doc:
Return the base API server URL without any version suffix.
Examples:
- https://api.deepl.com/v2 -> https://api.deepl.com
- https://api.free.deepl.com -> https://api.free.deepl.com
- custom provided server_url (with or without /vN) -> stripped of /vN
instance_methods.summary: Return the base API server URL without any version suffix.

def.name: create_glossary
def.body:
url = "#{server_url}/glossaries"
data = {"name" => name, "source_lang" => source_lang, "target_lang" => target_lang, "entries" => entries, "entries_format" => entry_format}
response = Crest.post(url, form: data, headers: http_headers_json)
handle_response(response, glossary: true)
GlossaryInfo.from_json(response.body)

instance_methods.summary: Create a multilingual glossary with specified name and dictionaries

def.name: create_multilingual_glossary
def.body:
url = "#{base_server_url}/v3/glossaries"


dict_data = dictionaries.map do |dict|
  {"source_lang" => dict.source_lang, "target_lang" => dict.target_lang, "entries" => dict.entries, "entries_format" => dict.entries_format || "tsv"}
end

data = {"name" => name, "dictionaries" => dict_data}

response = Crest.post(url, json: data, headers: http_headers_json)
handle_response(response, glossary: true)
MultilingualGlossaryInfo.from_json(response.body)

true

def.name: find_glossary_info_by_name
def.body:
glossaries = list_glossaries
glossary_info = glossaries.find do |g| g.name == name end
if glossary_info
else
  raise(GlossaryNameNotFoundError.new(name))
end
glossary_info

def.name: find_multilingual_glossary_by_name
def.body:
glossaries = list_multilingual_glossaries
glossary = glossaries.find do |g| g.name == name end
if glossary
else
  raise(GlossaryNameNotFoundError.new(name))
end
glossary

def.name: get_glossary_entries
def.body:
header = http_headers_base
header["Accept"] = "text/tab-separated-values"
url = "#{server_url}/glossaries/#{glossary_id}/entries"
response = Crest.get(url, headers: header)
handle_response(response, glossary: true)
response.body

GlossaryInfo.from_json(response.body)

def.body:

glossaries.select do |g| g.name == name end

def.name: get_usage
def.body:
if auth_key_is_mock?
  get_usage_free
elsif auth_key_is_free_account?
  get_usage_free
else
  get_usage_pro
end

def.name: guess_target_language
def.body:
tl = ENV["DEEPL_TARGET_LANG"]?
if tl
  return tl
end


{% if (flag?(:darwin)) || (flag?(:unix)) %}
        ENV["LANG"]?.try &.split("_").try &.first.upcase || "EN"
      {% elsif flag?(:windows) %}
        l = `powershell -Command "[System.Globalization.CultureInfo]::CurrentCulture.TwoLetterISOLanguageName"`
        l.empty? ? "EN" : l.strip.upcase
      {% else %}
        # From official deepl documentation, EN is deprecated.
        # EN-US or EN-GB is recommended.
        "EN"
      {% end %}

handle_response(response, glossary: true)

Array(GlossaryInfo).from_json(glossaries_json)

instance_methods.name: patch_multilingual_glossary
instance_methods.args_string: (glossary_id : String, name : String | Nil = nil, dictionaries : Array(GlossaryDictionary) | Nil = nil) : MultilingualGlossaryInfo
instance_methods.args_html: (glossary_id : String, name : String | Nil = nil, dictionaries : Array(GlossaryDictionary) | Nil = nil) : MultilingualGlossaryInfo

def.name: patch_multilingual_glossary
def.body:
url = "#{base_server_url}/v3/glossaries/#{glossary_id}"

data = {} of String => JSON::Any::Type
if name
  data["name"] = name
end

if dictionaries
  dict_data = dictionaries.map do |dict|
    {"source_lang" => dict.source_lang, "target_lang" => dict.target_lang, "entries" => dict.entries, "entries_format" => dict.entries_format || "tsv"}
  end
  data["dictionaries"] = dict_data
end

response = Crest.patch(url, json: data, headers: http_headers_json)
handle_response(response, glossary: true)
MultilingualGlossaryInfo.from_json(response.body)

instance_methods.doc: Replace or create a dictionary in the glossary
instance_methods.summary: Replace or create a dictionary in the glossary

instance_methods.args_html: (glossary_id : String, source_lang : String, target_lang : String, entries : String, entries_format : String = "tsv") : GlossaryEntriesInformation

def.body:
url = "#{base_server_url}/v3/glossaries/#{glossary_id}/dictionaries"

data = {"source_lang" => source_lang, "target_lang" => target_lang, "entries" => entries, "entries_format" => entries_format}

response = Crest.put(url, json: data, headers: http_headers_json)
handle_response(response, glossary: true)
GlossaryEntriesInformation.from_json(response.body)

instance_methods.name: rephrase_text
instance_methods.args_string: (text : String | Array(String), target_lang = nil, writing_style = nil, tone = nil) : Array(RephraseResult)
instance_methods.args_html: (text : String | Array(String), target_lang = nil, writing_style = nil, tone = nil) : Array(RephraseResult)

def.name: rephrase_text
def.body:
if text.is_a?(String)
  text = [text]
end

params = Hash(String, String | Array(String)).new
params["text"] = text
if target_lang
  params["target_lang"] = target_lang
end
if writing_style
  params["writing_style"] = writing_style
end
if tone
  params["tone"] = tone
end

response = Crest.post(api_url_rephrase, form: params, headers: http_headers_json, json: true)

handle_response(response)
parse_rephrase_response(response)

instance_methods.name: resolve_glossary_id_from_name
instance_methods.doc:
Resolve glossary_id from glossary name across API versions.
- In v2 mode, use find_glossary_info_by_name (returns GlossaryInfo)
- In v3 mode, use find_multilingual_glossary_by_name (returns MultilingualGlossaryInfo)
Raises GlossaryNameNotFoundError if not found (delegated).
instance_methods.summary: Resolve glossary_id from glossary name across API versions.

instance_methods.name: translate_document
instance_methods.args_string: (path, target_lang, source_lang = nil, formality = nil, glossary_id = nil, glossary_name = nil, output_format = nil, output_file = nil, interval = 5.0, message_prefix = "[deepl.cr] ", &block : String -> )
instance_methods.args_html: (path, target_lang, source_lang = nil, formality = nil, glossary_id = nil, glossary_name = nil, output_format = nil, output_file = nil, interval = 5.0, message_prefix = "[deepl.cr] ", &block : String -> )

def.name: translate_document
def.body: translate_document(path: path, target_lang: target_lang, source_lang: source_lang, formality: formality, glossary_id: glossary_id, glossary_name: glossary_name, output_format: output_format, output_file: output_file, interval: interval, message_prefix: message_prefix, block: block)

instance_methods.name: translate_document
instance_methods.args_string: (path, target_lang, source_lang = nil, formality = nil, glossary_id = nil, glossary_name = nil, output_format = nil, output_file = nil, interval = 5.0, message_prefix = "[deepl.cr] ", block : String ->  | Nil = nil)
instance_methods.args_html: (path, target_lang, source_lang = nil, formality = nil, glossary_id = nil, glossary_name = nil, output_format = nil, output_file = nil, interval = 5.0, message_prefix = "[deepl.cr] ", block : String -> | Nil = nil)

def.name: translate_document
def.body:
source_path = Path[path]

document_handle = translate_document_upload(path: source_path, target_lang: target_lang, source_lang: source_lang, formality: formality, glossary_id: glossary_id, glossary_name: glossary_name, output_format: output_format)

prefix = message_prefix
block.try(&.call("#{prefix}Document uploaded"))
block.try(&.call("#{prefix}File: #{source_path}"))
block.try(&.call("#{prefix}ID: #{document_handle.id}"))
block.try(&.call("#{prefix}Key: #{document_handle.key}"))

translate_document_wait_until_done(document_handle, interval) do |document_status|
  block.try(&.call("#{prefix}Status: #{document_status.status}"))
  if document_status.seconds_remaining
    block.try(&.call("#{prefix}Seconds Remaining: #{document_status.seconds_remaining}"))
  end
  if document_status.billed_characters
    block.try(&.call("#{prefix}Billed Characters: #{document_status.billed_characters}"))
  end
  if document_status.error_message
    block.try(&.call("#{prefix}Error Message: #{document_status.error_message}"))
  end
end

output_file || (output_file = generate_output_file(source_path, target_lang, output_format))

block.try(&.call("#{prefix}Downloading translated document to #{output_file}"))
translate_document_download(document_handle, output_file)

block.try(&.call("#{prefix}Document saved as #{output_file}"))

def.name: translate_document_download
def.body:
data = {"document_key" => handle.key}
url = "#{api_url_document}/#{handle.id}/result"
Crest.post(url, form: data, headers: http_headers_json) do |response|
  if response.success?
  else
    raise(DocumentTranslationError.new)
  end
  File.open(output_file, "wb") do |file|
    IO.copy(response.body_io, file)
  end
end

def.name: translate_document_get_status
def.body:
url = "#{api_url_document}/#{handle.id}"
data = {"document_key" => handle.key}
response = Crest.post(url, form: data, headers: http_headers_json)
handle_response(response)
DocumentStatus.from_json(response.body)

instance_methods.name: translate_document_upload
instance_methods.args_string: (path : Path | String, target_lang, source_lang = nil, formality = nil, glossary_id = nil, glossary_name = nil, output_format = nil) : DocumentHandle
instance_methods.args_html: (path : Path | String, target_lang, source_lang = nil, formality = nil, glossary_id = nil, glossary_name = nil, output_format = nil) : DocumentHandle

def.name: translate_document_upload
def.body:
if path.is_a?(String)
  path = Path[path]
end
if glossary_name
  glossary_id || (glossary_id = resolve_glossary_id_from_name(glossary_name))
end
params = {"source_lang" => source_lang, "formality" => formality, "target_lang" => target_lang, "glossary_id" => glossary_id, "output_format" => output_format}.compact!
file = File.open(path)
params = params.merge({"file" => file})

response = Crest.post(api_url_document, form: params, headers: http_headers_base)
handle_response(response)

DocumentHandle.from_json(response.body)

instance_methods.name: translate_document_wait_until_done
instance_methods.args_string: (handle : DocumentHandle, interval = 5.0, block : DocumentStatus ->  | Nil = nil)

def.name: translate_document_wait_until_done
def.body:
loop do
  sleep_interval_ns = (interval * 1000000000).to_i64
  sleep(Time::Span.new(nanoseconds: sleep_interval_ns))

  document_status = translate_document_get_status(handle)

  block.try(&.call(document_status))

  case document_status.status
  when "done"
    break
  when "error"
    raise(DocumentTranslationError.new(document_status.error_message))
  end
end

instance_methods.name: translate_text
instance_methods.args_string: (text : String | Array(String), target_lang, source_lang = nil, context = nil, show_billed_characters : Bool | Nil = nil, split_sentences = nil, preserve_formatting : Bool | Nil = nil, formality = nil, glossary_id = nil, glossary_name = nil, tag_handling = nil, outline_detection : Bool | Nil = nil, non_splitting_tags : Array(String) | Nil = nil, splitting_tags : Array(String) | Nil = nil, ignore_tags : Array(String) | Nil = nil, model_type = nil) : Array(TextResult)
instance_methods.args_html: (text : String | Array(String), target_lang, source_lang = nil, context = nil, show_billed_characters : Bool | Nil = nil, split_sentences = nil, preserve_formatting : Bool | Nil = nil, formality = nil, glossary_id = nil, glossary_name = nil, tag_handling = nil, outline_detection : Bool | Nil = nil, non_splitting_tags : Array(String) | Nil = nil, splitting_tags : Array(String) | Nil = nil, ignore_tags : Array(String) | Nil = nil, model_type = nil) : Array(TextResult)

def.name: translate_text
def.body:
if glossary_name
  glossary_id || (glossary_id = resolve_glossary_id_from_name(glossary_name))
end

if text.is_a?(String)
  text = [text]
end

params = {"text" => text, "target_lang" => target_lang, "source_lang" => source_lang, "formality" => formality, "glossary_id" => glossary_id, "context" => context, "show_billed_characters" => show_billed_characters, "split_sentences" => split_sentences, "preserve_formatting" => preserve_formatting, "tag_handling" => tag_handling, "outline_detection" => outline_detection, "non_splitting_tags" => non_splitting_tags, "splitting_tags" => splitting_tags, "ignore_tags" => ignore_tags, "model_type" => model_type}.compact!

response = Crest.post(api_url_translate, form: params, headers: http_headers_json, json: true)

handle_response(response)
parse_translate_text_response(response)
